oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A woman driving an electric automobile, Nashville, Tennessee, circa 1910
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A woman driving an electric automobile with a Tennessee license plate along a road, circa 1910. This electric automobile was powered by a rechargeable lead acid battery, a model that was mainly sold to women drivers who desired a vehicle without a demanding hand cranking of the engine that was required of the early internal combustion engine autos. Forms part of Mrs. Libbie (Walsh) Teachout Papers. 1 photograph negative : b & w ; 4 x 5 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Teachout family; Walsh family
